intro: Blakea tapantiana, commonly known as the golden star or yellow star, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive star-like shape. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are usually ovate and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Blakea tapantiana is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting biodiversity in its native habitat.
